title: Brexit: Boris Johnson's team plot new Bill tomorrow to push for a general election
text:

Number 10 are preparing to bring forward a one-line election bill "almost identical" to the plan mooted by the Lib Dems yesterday.

The PM is expected to struggle to muster the two thirds of MPs he needs to trigger an election when it comes to a vote this evening.

But opposition parties have made plans to table a ‘one-line’ bill that could force an election with just a simple majority in the Commons - but could be amended by MPs.

Downing Street said yesterday they would consider backing “something like” that option tomorrow if tonight’s vote doesn’t go their way.

And today, a Number 10 source said: "Tonight is Labour ’s last chance to have election with Brexit delivered - they can vote for 12th and get Brexit done before.

"If not, we will introduce a Bill almost identical to the Lib Dem/ SNP tomorrow”.

(Image: UK PARLIAMENT/AFP via Getty Imag)

But support from opposition parties for the one line bill will come with conditions.

A Lib Dem source said the party would demand a "triple lock" of protection from a no-deal Brexit, ruling out using it to push through the Withdrawal Agreement Bill (WAB) and making the date of the election explicit in the bill.

But the source did not rule out tabling, backing or abstaining on other amendments to the one-line bill.

Lib Dems could abstain if another party brings forward, for instance, amendments to allow votes for 16-year-olds, or extend the franchise to EU citizens - causes the Libs are sympathetic to.

"We need to break the gridlock,” the source said.

"We’ve run out of time. All the EU figures are clear that we’re not going to get another extension”.
description: The Government is expected to bring forward their own election Bill - 'almost identical' to a plan by the Lib Dems - if they lose tonight's vote
